Replicate metrics.

Replicate metrics.

replicate_metrics(fit_model, predict_model, resample, preprocess, measure, X, y,
  train_size = train_size, categorical_variables = NULL,
  n_divisions = 1000, n_iterations = 100, progress_bar = TRUE,
  n_core = 1, foldid = NULL, ...)

Arguments

fit_model
A function; the function for fitting a model to the data.
predict_model
A function; the function for generating predictions from a fitted model.
resample
A function; the function for resampling the data. Defaults to NULL.
preprocess
A function; the function for preprocessing the data. Defaults to NULL.
measure
A function; the function for measuring the results. Defaults to NULL.
X
A matrix; the independent variables.
y
A vector; the dependent variable.
train_size
A numeric vector of length one; specifies what proportion of the data should be used for the training data set. Defaults to 0.667.
categorical_variables
A logical vector; each value TRUE indicates that column in the data.frame is a categorical variable. Defaults to NULL.
n_divisions
An integer vector of length one; specifies the number of times the data should be divided when replicating the error metrics. Defaults to 1000L.
n_iterations
An integer vector of length one; during each division, specifies the number of times the predictions should be replicated. Defaults to 10L.
progress_bar
A logical vector of length one; specifies whether to display a progress bar during calculations. Defaults to TRUE.
n_core
An integer vector of length one; specifies the number of cores to use for this analysis. Currenly only works on Mac OSx and Unix/Linux systems. Defaults to 1L.
foldid
A vector with length equal to length(y) which identifies cases belonging to the same fold.
...
The arguments to be passed to the algorithm specified.

Value

A list of matrixes, the replicated metrics.

See also

Other replicate: replicate_coefficients, replicate_predictions, replicate_variable_importances

Contents
